data.event: On 18 May 1850, Phillip Levi purchased the land sections 1104-1107, Hundred of Port Adelaide.

By April 1851, section 1106 was owned by John Lapthorne, who had subdivided it sometime before January 1854, however the name of Exeter does not appear on official documents until 1882 when William Wells cut part of section 1106.

event.title: had subdivided it sometime before January 1854

event.title: does not appear on official documents until 1882

By April 1851, section 1106 was owned by John Lapthorne, who had subdivided it sometime before January 1854, however the name of Exeter does not appear on official documents until 1882 when William Wells cut part of section 1106.

event.title: sailed to South Australia on the Orissa in 1840

data.event: John Lapthorne sailed to South Australia on the Orissa in 1840.

event.title: was born in Exeter, in the English county of Devon, in 1807

data.event: He was born in Exeter, in the English county of Devon, in 1807 and died at Exeter, Adelaide in 1889; the suburb is named after his home town.
He was born in Exeter, in the English county of Devon, in 1807 and died at Exeter, Adelaide in 1889; the suburb is named after his home town.
